articles.description: Jannik Sinner says it "means so much" to win the US Open after a "very difficult" few months in the build-up to the Grand Slam.
articles.title: US Open 2024: Jannik Sinner says title 'means so much' after 'very difficult' build-up

articles.description: England have the “belief” they can beat Sri Lanka, but Paul Collingwood admits it will be “one hell of a Test match to win” from the position the hosts are in.
articles.title: England vs Sri Lanka: 'One hell of a Test to win' - Paul Collingwood

articles.description: The Paris 2024 Paralympics Games close with a sparkling ceremony on Sunday, rounding off a fantastic summer of sport in the French capital.
articles.title: Paris 2024 Paralympics: Games closing with party at Stade de France

articles.description: The Dallas Cowboys agree a contract extension with quarterback Dak Prescott which is set to make him the highest-paid player in NFL history.
articles.title: Dak Prescott: Dallas Cowboys QB to become highest-paid player in NFL history

articles.description: The British team rose to the occasion at the Paris Paralympics, said ParalympicsGB chef de mission Penny Briscoe as the Games closed on Sunday.
articles.title: Paris 2024 Paralympics: Best stats as GB win medals in 18 out of 19 sports

articles.description: The Miami Dolphins say wide receiver Tyreek Hill was detained by police prior to their season opener with the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sunday.
articles.title: NFL: Miami Dolphins star Tyreek Hill detained by police before game

articles.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill feels the playing surface at the Stadion Hristo Botev was as poor as he had seen in "a long time" after his side were beaten by Bulgaria in the Nations League.
articles.title: Nations League: Pitch in Bulgaria during Northern Ireland loss was not acceptable says Michael O'Neill
